channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Council owned tree causing problems, 14th November
item.description:
There is a council owned tree in the front garden of 16 Belmont Park which has not been maintained by the Council in approximately 20 years. It need pruning and/or completely cutting down as it causes non stop falling leaves all over the pavement which is very dangerous to pedestrians, especially the elderly. it also causes dampness and cuts out all light to the flats in number 16
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Middleton Way, Hither Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large tree partially fallen onto driveway., 14th November
item.description:
Between 12.30 and 14.30 large willow tree has fallen across driveidenrs. It has almost fallen i to the flats andway to houses and flats blocking access to highway for several cars belonging to residents. It has almost hit the flats and could still do so. Also children are trying to walk beneath it. Council have stated they MIGHT come on Monday

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dolphin Close, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing manhole cover on the pavement, 14th November
item.description:
The manhole cover has been removed from the side of the pavement near to 70 Widmore Road, Bromley. The manhole cover is to the side of the hole therefore may be a danger to passing pedestrians. This location is described as beside a tree and by the bus lane sign.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Widmore Road, Widmore, London

item.title: Flooding of drain outside station, 14th November
item.description:
This happens every time it rains and has been ongoing for months, causing the drop of area to be unusable and often flooding the road as well. The minicab drivers have tried to unblock in the past as no-one has ever come to fix it, but the problem is ongoing causing difficulty for vehicles and pedestrians.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bramley Road, Cockfosters, London
